title: MySQLCOUNT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLCOUNT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the number of products in the "Products" table:
SELECT COUNT(ProductID) AS NumberOfProducts FROM Products;

Definition and Usage
The COUNT() function returns the number of records returned by a select query.
Note:
NULL values are not counted.
Syntax
COUNT(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. A field or a string value
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example

quiz.question: What is NULL values?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of NULL values is 'not counted'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLCOUNT()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLCOUNT()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLCOUNT()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
